TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit BatchPoolSpecification extends System.Object implements class System.ClientModel.Primitives.IJsonModel`1<class Azure.Compute.Batch.BatchPoolSpecification>, class System.ClientModel.Primitives.IPersistableModel`1<class Azure.Compute.Batch.BatchPoolSpecification>
Public Class BatchPoolSpecification Implements IJsonModel(Of BatchPoolSpecification), IPersistableModel(Of BatchPoolSpecification)
type BatchPoolSpecification = class interface IJsonModel<BatchPoolSpecification> interface IPersistableModel<BatchPoolSpecification>

Docs.summary: Specification for creating a new Pool.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string vmSize) cil managed

Docs.param: The size of the virtual machines in the Pool. All virtual machines in a Pool are the same size. For information about available sizes of virtual machines in Pools, see Choose a VM size for Compute Nodes in an Azure Batch Pool (https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/batch/batch-pool-vm-sizes).
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of .

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ApplicationPackageReferences As IList(Of BatchApplicationPackageReference)

Docs.summary: The list of Packages to be installed on each Compute Node in the Pool. When creating a pool, the package's application ID must be fully qualified (/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/Microsoft.Batch/batchAccounts/{accountName}/applications/{applicationName}). Changes to Package references affect all new Nodes joining the Pool, but do not affect Compute Nodes that are already in the Pool until they are rebooted or reimaged. There is a maximum of 10 Package references on any given Pool.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property AutoScaleEvaluationInterval As Nullable(Of TimeSpan)
member this.AutoScaleEvaluationInterval : Nullable<TimeSpan> with get, set

Docs.summary: The time interval at which to automatically adjust the Pool size according to the autoscale formula. The default value is 15 minutes. The minimum and maximum value are 5 minutes and 168 hours respectively. If you specify a value less than 5 minutes or greater than 168 hours, the Batch service rejects the request with an invalid property value error; if you are calling the REST API directly, the HTTP status code is 400 (Bad Request).

MemberSignature.Value: member this.AutoScaleFormula : string with get, set

Docs.summary: The formula for the desired number of Compute Nodes in the Pool. This property must not be specified if enableAutoScale is set to false. It is required if enableAutoScale is set to true. The formula is checked for validity before the Pool is created. If the formula is not valid, the Batch service rejects the request with detailed error information.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property CertificateReferences As IList(Of BatchCertificateReference)

Docs.summary: For Windows Nodes, the Batch service installs the Certificates to the specified Certificate store and location. For Linux Compute Nodes, the Certificates are stored in a directory inside the Task working directory and an environment variable AZ_BATCH_CERTIFICATES_DIR is supplied to the Task to query for this location. For Certificates with visibility of 'remoteUser', a 'certs' directory is created in the user's home directory (e.g., /home/{user-name}/certs) and Certificates are placed in that directory. Warning: This property is deprecated and will be removed after February, 2024. Please use the [Azure KeyVault Extension](https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/batch/batch-certificate-migration-guide) instead.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.DisplayName : string with get, set

Docs.summary: The display name for the Pool. The display name need not be unique and can contain any Unicode characters up to a maximum length of 1024.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property EnableAutoScale As Nullable(Of Boolean)
member this.EnableAutoScale : Nullable<bool> with get, set

Docs.summary: Whether the Pool size should automatically adjust over time. If false, at least one of targetDedicatedNodes and targetLowPriorityNodes must be specified. If true, the autoScaleFormula element is required. The Pool automatically resizes according to the formula. The default value is false.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property EnableInterNodeCommunication As Nullable(Of Boolean)
member this.EnableInterNodeCommunication : Nullable<bool> with get, set

Docs.summary: Whether the Pool permits direct communication between Compute Nodes. Enabling inter-node communication limits the maximum size of the Pool due to deployment restrictions on the Compute Nodes of the Pool. This may result in the Pool not reaching its desired size. The default value is false.

Docs.summary: To be added.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Metadata As IList(Of MetadataItem)

Docs.summary: A list of name-value pairs associated with the Pool as metadata. The Batch service does not assign any meaning to metadata; it is solely for the use of user code.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property MountConfiguration As IList(Of MountConfiguration)

Docs.summary: A list of file systems to mount on each node in the pool. This supports Azure Files, NFS, CIFS/SMB, and Blobfuse.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.NetworkConfiguration : Azure.Compute.Batch.NetworkConfiguration with get, set

Docs.summary: The network configuration for the Pool.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property ResizeTimeout As Nullable(Of TimeSpan)
member this.ResizeTimeout : Nullable<TimeSpan> with get, set

Docs.summary: The timeout for allocation of Compute Nodes to the Pool. This timeout applies only to manual scaling; it has no effect when enableAutoScale is set to true. The default value is 15 minutes. The minimum value is 5 minutes. If you specify a value less than 5 minutes, the Batch service rejects the request with an error; if you are calling the REST API directly, the HTTP status code is 400 (Bad Request).

MemberSignature.Value: member this.ResourceTags : string with get, set

Docs.summary: The user-specified tags associated with the pool.The user-defined tags to be associated with the Azure Batch Pool. When specified, these tags are propagated to the backing Azure resources associated with the pool. This property can only be specified when the Batch account was created with the poolAllocationMode property set to 'UserSubscription'.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.StartTask : Azure.Compute.Batch.BatchStartTask with get, set

Docs.summary: A Task to run on each Compute Node as it joins the Pool. The Task runs when the Compute Node is added to the Pool or when the Compute Node is restarted.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property TargetDedicatedNodes As Nullable(Of Integer)
member this.TargetDedicatedNodes : Nullable<int> with get, set

Docs.summary: The desired number of dedicated Compute Nodes in the Pool. This property must not be specified if enableAutoScale is set to true. If enableAutoScale is set to false, then you must set either targetDedicatedNodes, targetLowPriorityNodes, or both.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property TargetLowPriorityNodes As Nullable(Of Integer)
member this.TargetLowPriorityNodes : Nullable<int> with get, set

Docs.summary: The desired number of Spot/Low-priority Compute Nodes in the Pool. This property must not be specified if enableAutoScale is set to true. If enableAutoScale is set to false, then you must set either targetDedicatedNodes, targetLowPriorityNodes, or both.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property TargetNodeCommunicationMode As Nullable(Of BatchNodeCommunicationMode)

Docs.summary: The desired node communication mode for the pool. If omitted, the default value is Default.
How Tasks are distributed across Compute Nodes in a Pool. If not specified, the default is spread.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property TaskSlotsPerNode As Nullable(Of Integer)
member this.TaskSlotsPerNode : Nullable<int> with get, set

Docs.summary: The number of task slots that can be used to run concurrent tasks on a single compute node in the pool. The default value is 1. The maximum value is the smaller of 4 times the number of cores of the vmSize of the pool or 256.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.UpgradePolicy : Azure.Compute.Batch.UpgradePolicy with get, set

Docs.summary: The upgrade policy for the Pool. Describes an upgrade policy - automatic, manual, or rolling.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property UserAccounts As IList(Of UserAccount)

Docs.summary: The list of user Accounts to be created on each Compute Node in the Pool.
The virtual machine configuration for the Pool. This property must be specified.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.VmSize : string with get, set

Docs.summary: The size of the virtual machines in the Pool. All virtual machines in a Pool are the same size. For information about available sizes of virtual machines in Pools, see Choose a VM size for Compute Nodes in an Azure Batch Pool (https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/batch/batch-pool-vm-sizes).
